news.title: What LDA & LMC propose to do with Sahara land, asks Allahabad HC
news.para: The Allahabad High Court has sought details from the Lucknow Development Authority and municipal corporation. The court wants to know their plans for land reclaimed from Sahara India Commercial Corporation Limited in Gomtinagar. This information is being sought without prejudice to Sahara's ongoing petition. The court has fixed the next hearing for January 19.

news.title: Nashik to get incentive FSI for redevelopment: Maharashtra deputy CM
news.para: Nashik city will soon get enhanced Floor Space Index benefits for redeveloping old buildings. Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde assured this to trade and industry associations. This move aims to speed up urban renewal and upgrade aging infrastructure. Developers had highlighted financial unviability due to lower FSI compared to Thane and Pune.

news.title: Prayagraj civic body to issue notices to 40,000 house tax defaulters
news.para: Prayagraj Municipal Corporation will soon issue notices to 40,000 property owners who have not paid taxes for three years. Those failing to clear dues within 15 days will face property attachment and water supply disconnection. This move aims to boost tax recovery. Buildings will be reopened only after full payment. Breaking seals will lead to legal action.

news.title: Lucknow development body conducts lottery for 1,665 1BHK flats under Atalnagar Yojana
news.para: The Lucknow Development Authority held a lottery for 1BHK flats in Atalnagar Yojana.  1,665 flats were allotted through a transparent, live-streamed process.  Applicants expressed relief and joy at securing a permanent home.  The draw for 2BHK flats is scheduled for Friday.  The scheme received over 5,700 applications for the 2,496 flats.

news.title: NGT gives Greater Noida authority one month to file report on illegal constructions
news.para: The Greater Noida Development Authority has failed to submit a report on illegal constructions to the National Green Tribunal. The tribunal has now given the Authority one month to file an affidavit. A former corporator had filed a petition highlighting illegal constructions and groundwater extraction.

news.title: Oberoi Realty, Shree Naman in race for Railway’s 11-acre land in Mumbai's Bandra
news.para: Oberoi Realty and Shree Naman Developers are eligible bidders for a prime 11.21-acre railway land parcel in Mumbai's Bandra. The Railway Land Development Authority set a reserve price of Rs 5,365 crore for the land. This is the third land parcel monetised by RLDA in Mumbai recently.

news.title: SWAMIH Fund helps complete 61,000 homes in stalled projects till December 15
news.para: The SWAMIH fund has  facilitated over 61,000 homes in previously stalled projects. This government-backed initiative is poised to close the gap on more than one lakh homes, thereby benefiting upwards of four lakh people.

news.title: DRA Homes partners with Yubi to establish ₹250 crore secured debt platform
news.para: DRA Homes has joined forces with Yubi Group to establish a ₹250 crore secured debt initiative. This funding is earmarked solely for land acquisition, a strategic move underscored by Ranjeeth Rathod, managing director, who emphasized the importance of institutionalizing land sourcing through secure, non-dilutive capital.

news.title: Patna civic body imposes strict measures to curb construction dust pollution
news.para: In response to alarming air quality levels, Patna’s authorities have introduced stringent guidelines for managing construction debris. The Municipal Corporation is enforcing the use of designated disposal areas and green mesh at all construction sites, aiming to tackle the escalating dust pollution.

news.title: Shree KB Realty buys three-acre land in Greater Noida via auction for ₹122 crore
news.para: Shree KB Realty has secured a prime 3-acre site in Greater Noida for a remarkable Rs 122 crore. This strategic acquisition, completed through an auction conducted by the Greater Noida Authority, is set to pave the way for a  commercial development.

news.title: Prop-tech startup Flent raises ₹21 crore
news.para: Flent, a proptech startup, has clinched ₹21 crore in a pre-series A funding round, combining both equity and debt investments. With these funds, the company is set to enhance its workforce and broaden its horizons beyond Bengaluru, eyeing markets like Mumbai and Gurugram for future launches.

news.title: Karnataka cabinet approves A-khata for B-khata properties in illegal layouts
news.para: The Karnataka Cabinet has taken a pivotal step by approving the issuance of A-khata certificates for B-khata properties found in illegally established layouts. Properties that are part of legally sanctioned layouts are granted A-khata, contrasting with B-khata properties in unapproved areas.

news.title: Navi Mumbai: 19 construction sites get stop-work notices for flouting anti-pollution norms
news.para: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation has halted construction at 19 sites noted for their subpar air quality. In conjunction, 173 developers have been slapped with penalty notices for violating pollution control regulations.

news.title: Sundaram-Clayton to sell 16.38 acres in Chennai to Prestige–Arihant JV for ₹560 crore
news.para: Sundaram-Clayton is selling a large land parcel in Chennai to Canopy Living LLP for Rs 560 crore. This move aims to unlock value by monetising non-core assets. The deal is expected to be completed soon. Canopy Living LLP plans to develop a major residential project on the land.

news.title: NDMC presents surplus budget for 2026-27; rules out property tax hike
news.para: The New Delhi Municipal Council has announced a forward-thinking surplus budget for the 2026-27 fiscal year. With no changes to property tax rates, the council is prioritizing modern urban innovations, sustainable practices, and the protection of its rich heritage.

news.title: Freehold conversion restart to spur Lutyens’ Delhi property deals
news.para: A Rs 1,100-crore-plus transaction of the first official residence of the country’s first prime minister Jawaharlal Nehru at 17 York Road (now Motilal Nehru Road) in the Lutyens’ Bungalow Zone is among the deals on hold because L&DO had paused the process of converting leasehold properties to freehold.

news.title: Rohit Sharma’s wife buys apartment in Mumbai for ₹26.30 crore
news.para: Ritika Sajdeh, wife of cricketer Rohit Sharma, has acquired a luxurious apartment in Mumbai's Ahuja Towers. The property, located in Prabhadevi, spans 2,760.40 sq ft and includes three car parking spaces. The deal was valued at ₹26.30 crore.

news.title: About 16,000 Chandrapur families to get permanent land titles: Maharashtra revenue minister
news.para: Maharashtra Revenue Minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule announced that nearly 16,000 Chandrapur families will receive permanent land ownership rights for their slum settlements. This initiative, fulfilling a commitment made in the assembly, aims to accelerate inclusive urban development.

news.title: Kochi Metro’s Infopark extension likely to miss June 2026 deadline
news.para: Kochi Metro's Pink Line faces a June 30 deadline for its first stretch. Construction progress is slow, impacting the target. A foreign loan approval delay adds to the challenge. Completion is crucial for thousands of IT professionals commuting to Infopark. Authorities are urged to expedite work for improved public transport.

news.title: Gujarat government’s income from stamp duty and registration fee rises 7% in 9M FY25
news.para: Gujarat's revenue from stamp duty and registration fees has seen a significant 7% increase. This surge in income is attributed to a rise in property transaction values and substantial land deals across various cities. The state government's revenue is projected to surpass its budgetary target for the current financial year. This positive trend reflects a robust real estate market.
